docs.title: Why Node.js?
docs.description: 1. Non Blocking, 2. Single threaded event loop, 3. Event-driven servers, 4. Excellent support for REST-GRAPHQL, 5, Build in suppor for Promises

docs.title: Benefits
docs.description: Fast, Scalable, Asynchronous, Open Source, No Buffering, Tooling.

docs.title: Prototype Inheritance
docs.description: Fast, Scalable, Asynchronous, Open Source, No Buffering, Tooling.

docs.title: Streams
docs.description: Powerfull feature that allows data processing in chunks of data rather loading all the data into memory at once.

docs.title: Streams
docs.description: Powerfull feature that allows data processing in chunks of data rather loading all the data into memory at once., Writable, Readable, Duplex, Transform.

docs.title: module.exports
docs.description: Specifies what the module objects will be exported to importers

docs.title: How do you obtain the variables and property values passed through URL (GET method)?
Middleware
docs.description: Functions that can access the request, response, next objects in the applications request-response lifecycle.

docs.title: EventEmitter
docs.description: A class that provides a mechanism for publishing and subscribing to it's events. Example of group chat.

docs.title: package.json
docs.description: Project metadata file, Dependencies, configuration options and other relevant information.

docs.title: setTimeout
docs.description: A timer that executes a callback after the timer has expired

docs.title: process.nextTick()
docs.description: Executes a callback function on the current event loop iteration, after the current operation ends.
